Description: Ear-ring and 13 beads made in different material and shape. A: Fragment of an ear-ring in jasper, about half of it is preserved, one original end is still visible. The section is triangular and the surface is well polished, the inside shows drill lines. Along the edge an incised line on both sides and shallow notches along the edge. B: Flattened spherical bead made of a greyish-blackish glass, parts of the surface are chipped off, probably from a wrong firing temperature, the paste was not glazed properly. C: Biconical bead made of a white stone with a sharp edge. D: One and a half cylindrical bead made of turquoise faience. E: Six disc-shaped beads, five of them made of ostrich eggshell, well rounded and smoothed, one made of turquoise faience. F: Two small barrel-shaped beads made of glass (?) paste, in a turquoise colour at the ends, white in the middle. G: One small stone (?) roughly ovoid, partly broken, well polished at the other parts, white with a brown line, no perforation.
Acquisition notes: AW 1997/1 Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
